snippet: Connor McDavid, 17, a top prospect for the 2015 N.H.L. draft, is expected to miss five to six weeks after injuring his hand in a fight during a game with his junior team, the Erie Otters.
abstract: Canadian hockey center Connor McDavid, leading scorer in Ontario Hockey League and top prospect for the 2015 NHL draft, injures his hand in fight during game and is expected to miss five to six weeks of play; injury renews focus on role of fighting in hockey and in junior hockey in particular.
lead_paragraph: Connor McDavid, 17, a top prospect for the 2015 N.H.L. draft, is expected to miss five to six weeks after injuring his hand in a fight during a game with his junior team, the Erie Otters.

headline.seo: Connor McDavid, N.H.L. Prospect, Is Out Up to Six Weeks With Hand Injury
headline.main: Top Prospect’s Injury Renews Concerns About Fighting
headline.print_headline: Top Prospect’s Injury Renews Concerns About Fighting
